Body:
Is there a possibility to send SMS to an M2M number (in my case consisting of country code plus 13 digits) using Twilio?

I tried using curl:

curl -XPOST https://api.twilio.com/2010-04-01/Accounts/{AccountSID}/Messages.json -d Body=test" -d "To=%2Bxx xxxxxxxxxxxxx" -d "From=%2Bxx xxxxxxxxxxx" -u "{AccountSID}:{authToken}"

And the result is 

{"code": 21211
column9: "message": "The 'To' number +xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx is not a valid phone number."
column12:
since I can send SMS e.g. from my phone to this number.

When I remove the last three digits of the longer number
column13:
I do not get any error.

"

Body: Same issue here, trying a M2M number.
Yes, it does - as far as I know. The first two digits are a valid country code (+46), followed by 13 digits.
Yes, I did. But it still doesn't work.
Does the phone number you are trying to send to conform to the E.164 standard?
Did you try taking the space out of the phone number in your cURL?
